casebody.data:
Max MILLET and Dora Millet, Plaintiifs-Appellants, v. UNITED STATES of America, Defendant-Appellee. No. 283, Docket 26704. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Feb. 20, 1961. Decided March 23, 1961. Louis Granick, Brooklyn, N. Y., for plaintiffs-appellants. Richard S. Harrell, Asst. U. S. Atty., Eastern District of New York, Brooklyn, N. Y. (Cornelius W. Wickersham, Jr., U. S. Atty., E.D.N.Y., Brooklyn, N. Y., on the brief), for defendant-appellee.

Before HINCKS and MOORE, Circuit Judges, and BRENNAN, District Judge.*

Sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM.

Affirmed on the opinion below, 189 F. Supp. 88.
